DDS
Class ReferenceScope

java.lang.Object
  DDS.ReferenceScope

public final class ReferenceScope
extends java.lang.Object

The ReferenceScope class represents an enumeration of the possible scopes in which to view a relation. I.E. just the relation itself (SIMPLE) or also the object at the end point of the relation (REFERENCED).

Field Summary
static int _REFERENCED_CONTENTS_SCOPE
          This option indicates that not only the relation should be taken into account, but that the state of the related objects should also be taken into acount.
static int _SIMPLE_CONTENT_SCOPE
          This option indicates that only the relation should be taken into account.
static ReferenceScope REFERENCED_CONTENTS_SCOPE
          A convenience wrapper for the _REFERENCED_CONTENTS_SCOPE option of the ReferenceScope enumeration.
static ReferenceScope SIMPLE_CONTENT_SCOPE
          A convenience wrapper for the _SIMPLE_CONTENT_SCOPE option of the ReferenceScope enumeration.
 
Method Summary
static ReferenceScope from_int(int value)
          Returns the correct ReferenceScope object from the specified value or throws a runtime exception is the value is out of range.
 int value()
          This operation returns the value of this ReferenceScope, which is either simple content scope or referenced content scope.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Field Detail

_SIMPLE_CONTENT_SCOPE

public static final int _SIMPLE_CONTENT_SCOPE
This option indicates that only the relation should be taken into account. I.E. Has the relation or in case of a collection an element in the collection been modified.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SIMPLE_CONTENT_SCOPE

public static final ReferenceScope SIMPLE_CONTENT_SCOPE
A convenience wrapper for the _SIMPLE_CONTENT_SCOPE option of the ReferenceScope enumeration.

_REFERENCED_CONTENTS_SCOPE

public static final int _REFERENCED_CONTENTS_SCOPE
This option indicates that not only the relation should be taken into account, but that the state of the related objects should also be taken into acount. In case of a collection this means the state of each element in the collection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

REFERENCED_CONTENTS_SCOPE

public static final ReferenceScope REFERENCED_CONTENTS_SCOPE
A convenience wrapper for the _REFERENCED_CONTENTS_SCOPE option of the ReferenceScope enumeration.

Method Detail

value

public int value()
This operation returns the value of this ReferenceScope, which is either simple content scope or referenced content scope.

Returns:
the value of this ReferenceScope.

from_int

public static ReferenceScope from_int(int value)
Returns the correct ReferenceScope object from the specified value or throws a runtime exception is the value is out of range.

Parameters:
value - The value indicating the type of ReferenceScope
Returns:
The correct ReferenceScope matching the specified value
